newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 a tonne higher.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 a tonne higher.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $5 to $10 higher Tuesday after the London market managed to recover from the lows, dealers said.
LIFFE cocoa futures erased early weakness and traded mostly firmer Tuesday. Benchmark July rose four stg by the midday pause to 1,048 stg per tonne after slumping to 1,040 stg.

Monday, New York cocoa futures slumped toward the bottom of the day's range in extremely thin dealings. July futures finished down $15 at $1,454 a tonne after ranging from $1,468 to $1,452. Spot May -- which goes off the board in 2-1/2 weeks -- fell $23, to $1,442, while back months shed $3 to $16.

On the charts, traders pegged July's near-term resistance at $1,457-$1,460, followed by Friday's close of $1,469 and $1,480. Support was seen at $1,450, with a solid downside target noted at $1,438, then $1,430. ((--Patricia Avidan, New York Commodity Desk 212 859 1640))
